required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bone Marrow Aspirate Concentration in Posterior Cervical Fusion
clinical_study.official_title: Bone Marrow Aspirate Concentration in Posterior Cervical Fusion

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this research is to test if that combining bone marrow aspirate (removing bone marrow with a needle) concentration with locally harvested (collected) autograft (patient's own bone from another part of the body) for use as the bone graft results in equal rates of a successful procedure (fusion), as compared to current best practice in high-risk patients undergoing posterior cervical fusion.
Hypothesis: Bone marrow aspirate concentration combined with locally harvested autograft results in equivalent rates of bony fusion, as compared to current best practice in high-risk patients undergoing posterior cervical decompression and fusion.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Rate of fusion - (6, 12, and 24 months) Rate of fusion will be assessed by flexion extension X-rays at routine follow-up, translation method (<2mm) and/or by computed tomography (CT) scan at 2 year post-operatively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phyiscial and mental health from subject's point of view
secondary_outcome.description: Short Form 36 (SF-36) is a profile of functional health and well-being scores as well as psychometrically-based physical and mental health summary measures and a preference-based health utility index.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neck pain affects every day activities
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire that helps determine how a subject's neck pain affects their ability to manage every day activities.

arm_group.description: Group 1 will receive current best practice for posterior instrumented fusion (locally harvested autograft, demineralized bone matrix, and cadaveric allograft)
Group II, will receive locally harvested autograft and 20 cc of bone marrow aspirate concentration.

intervention.intervention_name: locally harvested autograft, demineralized bone matrix, and cadaveric allograft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 75
- Have at least one of the following high risk qualifications: BMI >30, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Osteoporosis, Current smoker
- Able to cooperate in the completion of standardized outcome measures (SF-36 & NDI)
- Willing and able to comply with study protocol
- cervical spondylosis requiring posterior instrument fusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existent neurologic disorder or mental disorder that would preclude accurate evaluation (psychiatric disease, Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease)
- History of previous anterior cervical fusion at the operative site
- Pregnant
- Active malignancy
- Previous history of posterior cervical decompression?

facility.name: Washington University in St. Louis School of Medicine
